title: Your Friday Briefing: Is China Relenting?
description: Plus: Kyiv in darkness, South Africa in turmoil and the week in culture.

title: Can Neymar and Brazil’s World Cup Team Unite a Fractured Nation?
description: Brazil’s World Cup team has become a political lightning rod at home after an ugly election. A championship might be the only thing that can bring Brazil together.

title: EU Talks Over Russian Oil Price Cap Drag On
description: The negotiations over a policy intended to crimp a vital source of revenue for Russia’s war effort have been going on for more than a week.

title: Ramaphosa’s Future as South Africa’s Leader in Doubt After Damning Report
description: An independent panel reported to Parliament that the South African president might have broken the law in a scandal over a large amount of cash hidden at his game farm that was then stolen.

title: China Appears to Loosen Covid Rules After Protests
description: Several cities announced the easing of lockdown regulations and testing requirements after the country’s biggest demonstrations in decades.

title: U.S. and Ukrainian Embassies Targeted by Letter Bombs in Spain
description: One of the six packages containing “pyrotechnic material” was also sent to the prime minister’s office in Madrid, prompting the authorities to increase security.

title: Lavrov Defends Strikes Against Ukraine’s Energy System
description: Russia’s foreign minister defended the strikes against Ukraine’s civilian infrastructure, which the United Nations has said could amount to war crimes.

title: The Atlantic Divide
description: The rising cost of living can look very different depending on where you live.

title: U.N. Asks for Record Amount of Aid to Deal With Growing Disasters and War
description: The United Nations’ appeal is aimed at tackling spiraling levels of desperation, fueled in part by Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: After Xi’s Coronation, a Roar of Discontent Against His Hard-Line Politics
description: Protests in China have roused a tradition of dissent that had seemed spent after 10 years under Xi Jinping. The effects may far outlast the street clashes.

title: An Agonizing Wait for a Migrant Worker’s Final Journey Home
description: The inequality and vulnerability that laborers from places like Nepal face overseas also stalk them in death, when dreams evaporate.

title: What Is Prince William’s Earthshot Prize?
description: The charity will award $6 million to five entrepreneurs from around the globe working on breakthrough climate solutions.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: A torrent of protest videos is testing the limits of China’s censorship apparatus.

title: Special Court Needed for Russian Crimes in Ukraine, EU Chief Says
description: The idea reflects frustration with the difficulty in holding anyone accountable in the war, and actually reaching trials in a new court is likely to be very hard.
